data.name: ParagraphProperties
desc: describes the style of paragraphs.
**since**
LibreOffice 4.2

types.name: ParaInteropGrabBag
desc: Grab bag of paragraph properties, used as a string-any map for interim interop purposes.
This property is intentionally not handled by the ODF filter. Any member that should be handled there should be first moved out from this grab bag to a separate property.
**since**
LibreOffice 4.2

types.name: ParaTabStops
desc: specifies the positions and kinds of the tab stops within this paragraph.

properties.name: BorderDistance
desc: contains the distance from the border to the object.

properties.name: BottomBorder
desc: contains the bottom border of the object.

properties.name: BottomBorderDistance
desc: contains the distance from the bottom border to the object.

properties.name: BreakType
desc: determines the type of break that is applied at the beginning of the table.

properties.name: ContinueingPreviousSubTree
desc: specifies that a child node of a parent node that is not counted is continuing the numbering of parent's previous node's sub tree.
**since**

properties.name: DropCapCharStyleName
desc: specifies the character style name for drop caps.

properties.name: DropCapFormat
desc: specifies whether the first characters of the paragraph are displayed in capital letters and how they are formatted.

properties.name: DropCapWholeWord
desc: specifies if the property DropCapFormat is applied to the whole first word.

properties.name: LeftBorder
desc: contains the left border of the object.

properties.name: LeftBorderDistance
desc: contains the distance from the left border to the object.

properties.name: ListId
desc: specifies the id of the list to which the paragraph belongs

properties.name: ListLabelString
desc: allows reading the generated numbering list label.
**since**

properties.name: NumberingIsNumber
desc: returns FALSE if the paragraph is part of a numbering, but has no numbering label.
A paragraph is part of a numbering, if a style for a numbering is set - see NumberingStyleName.
If the paragraph is not part of a numbering the property is void.

properties.name: NumberingLevel
desc: specifies the numbering level of the paragraph.

properties.name: NumberingRules
desc: contains the numbering rules applied to this paragraph.

properties.name: NumberingStartValue
desc: specifies the start value for numbering if a new numbering starts at this paragraph.

properties.name: NumberingStyleName
desc: specifies the name of the style for the numbering.
The name must be one of the names which are available via XStyleFamiliesSupplier.

properties.name: OutlineLevel
desc: specifies the outline level to which the paragraph belongs
Value 0 indicates that the paragraph belongs to the body text.
Values [1..10] indicates that the paragraph belongs to the corresponding outline level.
**since**
OOo 3.1

properties.name: PageDescName
desc: If this property is set, it creates a page break before the paragraph it belongs to and assigns the value as the name of the new page style sheet to use.

properties.name: PageNumberOffset
desc: If a page break property is set at a paragraph, this property contains the new value for the page number.

properties.name: PageStyleName
desc: contains the name of the current page style.

properties.name: ParaAdjust
desc: determines the adjustment of a paragraph.

properties.name: ParaBackColor
desc: contains the paragraph background color.

properties.name: ParaBackGraphic
desc: contains the graphic for the background of a paragraph.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: ParaBackGraphicFilter
desc: contains the name of the graphic filter for the background graphic of a paragraph.

properties.name: ParaBackGraphicLocation
desc: contains the value for the position of a background graphic.

properties.name: ParaBackGraphicURL
desc: contains the value of a link for the background graphic of a paragraph.

Note the new behaviour since it this was deprecated: This property can only be set and only external URLs are supported (no more vnd.sun.star.GraphicObject scheme). When an URL is set, then it will load the graphic and set the ParaBackGraphic property.

properties.name: ParaBackTransparent
desc: This value is TRUE if the paragraph background color is set to transparent.

properties.name: ParaBottomMargin
desc: determines the bottom margin of the paragraph in 100th mm.
The distance between two paragraphs is specified by:
The greater one is chosen.

properties.name: ParaContextMargin
desc: determines if contextual spacing is used.
If true, the top and bottom margins of the paragraph should not be applied when the previous and next paragraphs have the same style.
**since**
LibreOffice 3.6

properties.name: ParaExpandSingleWord
desc: determines if single words are stretched.
It is only valid if ParagraphProperties.ParaAdjust and ParagraphProperties.ParaLastLineAdjust are also valid.

properties.name: ParaFirstLineIndent
desc: specifies the indent for the first line.

properties.name: ParaHyphenationMaxHyphens
desc: specifies the maximum number of consecutive hyphens.

properties.name: ParaHyphenationMaxLeadingChars
desc: specifies the minimum number of characters to remain before the hyphen character (when hyphenation is applied).

properties.name: ParaHyphenationMaxTrailingChars
desc: specifies the minimum number of characters to remain after the hyphen character (when hyphenation is applied).

properties.name: ParaHyphenationNoCaps
desc: Specifies whether words written in CAPS will be hyphenated.
Setting to true will disable hyphenation of words written in CAPS for this paragraph.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.4

properties.name: ParaIsAutoFirstLineIndent
desc: determines if the first line should be indented automatically.

properties.name: ParaIsConnectBorder
desc: the property determines if borders set at a paragraph are merged with the next paragraph.
Borders are only merged if they are identical.

properties.name: ParaIsHyphenation
desc: specifies if automatic hyphenation is applied.

properties.name: ParaIsNumberingRestart
desc: determines if the numbering rules restart, counting at the current paragraph.

properties.name: ParaKeepTogether
desc: Setting this property to TRUE prevents page or column breaks between this and the following paragraph.
This feature is useful for preventing title paragraphs to be the last line on a page or column.

properties.name: ParaLastLineAdjust
desc: determines the adjustment of the last line.
It is only valid if ParagraphProperties.ParaAdjust is set to ParagraphAdjust.BLOCK.

properties.name: ParaLeftMargin
desc: determines the left margin of the paragraph in 100th mm.

properties.name: ParaLineNumberCount
desc: determines if the paragraph is included in the line numbering.

properties.name: ParaLineNumberStartValue
desc: contains the start value for the line numbering.

properties.name: ParaLineSpacing
desc: contains the type of the line spacing of a paragraph.

properties.name: ParaOrphans
desc: specifies the minimum number of lines of the paragraph that have to be at bottom of a page if the paragraph is spread over more than one page.

properties.name: ParaRegisterModeActive
desc: determines if the register mode is applied to a paragraph.
Remark: Register mode is only used if the register mode property of the page style is switched on.

properties.name: ParaRightMargin
desc: determines the right margin of the paragraph in 100th mm.

properties.name: ParaShadowFormat
desc: determines the type, color, and size of the shadow.

properties.name: ParaSplit
desc: Setting this property to FALSE prevents the paragraph from getting split into two pages or columns.

properties.name: ParaStyleName
desc: contains the name of the current paragraph style.

properties.name: ParaTopMargin
desc: determines the top margin of the paragraph in 100th mm.
The distance between two paragraphs is specified by:
The greater one is chosen.

properties.name: ParaUserDefinedAttributes
desc: this property stores xml attributes.
They will be saved to and restored from automatic styles inside xml files.

properties.name: ParaVertAlignment
desc: specifies the vertical alignment of a paragraph.

properties.name: ParaWidows
desc: specifies the minimum number of lines of the paragraph that have to be at top of a page if the paragraph is spread over more than one page.

properties.name: RightBorder
desc: contains the right border of the object.

properties.name: RightBorderDistance
desc: contains the distance from the right border to the object.

properties.name: TopBorder
desc: contains the top border of the object.

properties.name: TopBorderDistance
desc: contains the distance from the top border to the object.
